doc.title: Commodity Chemicals Week but Electronic Materials Strong
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.2 普通个人版/MS/Mitsubishi Gas Chemical Commodity Chemicals Weak but Electronic Materials StrongMitsubishi Gas Chemical Commodity Chemic_2025-08-29

passages.text: August 29, 2025 06:30 AM GMT
Mitsubishi Gas Chemical (4182) | Japan
WHAT'S CHANGEDMitsubishi Gas Chemical (4182.T)FromToPrice Target¥3,700¥3,300
BT materials (copper clad laminates) for IC packages appear to be garnering more share for FC- BGA.
We trim our F3/26 OP forecast but still have high conviction in a guidance beat.

Adjust PT to ¥3,300, stay OW: We lower our forecasts after 1Q OP missed our estimate, mainly relating to basic chemicals, and adjust our PT from ¥3,700 to ¥3,300 (target P/E 13.1x→12.9x, average of semis back- end materials avg. of 15.1x and fine chemicals avg. of 10.5x). However, we reiterate our OW rating for what we see as relatively high share price upside potential within the fine chemicals space.

Key points on 1Q results: 1Q OP missed our ¥13.5bn forecast, at ¥11.0bn (- 30% YoY). ¥2.1bn of the ¥2.5bn shortfall came in green energy & chemicals. Specialty chemicals also undershot by ¥700mn, largely due to inventory writedowns at the Chinese polycarbonates sub which we estimate at ¥900mn and hadn't factored for.

Summing up the CCL debate: 1Q sales of ¥21.9bn (+20% YoY) for special functional materials in the specialty chemicals segment beat our ¥21.5bn forecast. BT materials (copper clad laminates) and OPE (CCL raw material) did well. Our estimates put MGC's shares in BT materials in 2024 at \(\sim 55\%\) for the FC- CSP field and 5% for FC- BGA. More recently its share in FC- BGA looks to have topped 10% with increasing new uptake. Resonanc remains strong in this field, and we surmise that other players have lost share. MGC is strong in materials with low thermal expansion rates, and we also expect shipments for Al servers starting from 2026. OPE is used in printed circuit boards compatible with high frequencies, and applications are broadening from existing use in Al servers to ordinary servers, switches, and base stations.

Earnings forecasts: We expect 2Q OP of ¥14bn (- 22% YoY) to beat MGC's plan for ¥13bn, assuming writedown reversals and overestimation of company- wide costs in the plan. For BT materials, despite concerns about a shortage of raw- material glass cloth, we believe MGC has sufficient stocks of both raw materials and products. We also expect sales of special functional materials to beat plan in F3/26, and F3/27 to bring the wherewithal to absorb rising BT material quality- related costs (inspection costs) as production processes become more familiar. We have lowered our F3/26e OP from ¥52bn to ¥50bn (- 2% YoY) but still expect a beat vs. ¥46bn guidance, while our forecast for F3/27 is ¥64bn (+28% YoY).
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD +
Ryoichi Watanabe Equity Analyst
Mitsubishi Gas Chemical (4182.T, 4182 JT)
Fine Chemicals | Japan
Stock RatingOverweightIndustry ViewIn-LinePrice target¥3,300Up/downside to price target (%)22Shr price, close (Aug 28, 2025)¥2,701Mkt cap, cur, basic (bn)¥525.8Div yld (03/26e) (%)3.7

New Data Era: Positive Secular Growth: Positive Self-help: Positive View descriptions of Risk Rewards Themes here

Strong demand for AI servers, etc Strong demand for OPE for AI servers, BT for semiconductor packaging. Specialty chemicals sales top the base case by 10%. Methanol prices also top the base case by 10%.
Bull case FV is set using 12.9x P/E and a F3/27 EPS estimate of ¥339.5.
Semiconductor back-end materials stay
Base case FV is set using P/E of 12.9x and F3/27e EPS ¥258.1.
Weak demand for smartphone materials, etc

Specialty chemicals sales fall 10% short of our base case on weak demand for BT materials for IC packages, lupizeta EP for camera lenses, etc. Methanol prices are also 10% lower than our base case. Assumes a 25% drop in valuation.
Bear case FV is set using 9.7x P/E and a F3/27 EPS estimate of ¥177.7.

For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI ac Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
